body_html:
@csarofeen As there are 2 (12, 4) in the first layer, each for one direction. the input size of the l0 is 4, while the input size of l1 is 6 = 3(hidden of l0) * 2 (2 directions in l0).

input l0 output of l0
4 -----> 3 ------>6(combined)
-------> 3 ------->
body_text:
@csarofeen As there are 2 (12, 4) in the first layer, each for one direction. the input size of the l0 is 4, while the input size of l1 is 6 = 3(hidden of l0) * 2 (2 directions in l0).
input     l0     output of l0
4 -----> 3 ------>6(combined)
-------> 3 ------->
body:
@csarofeen As there are 2 `(12, 4)` in the first layer, each for one direction. the input size of the `l0` is `4`, while the input size of `l1` is `6 = 3(hidden of l0) * 2 (2 directions in l0)`. 

`input`     `l0`     `output of l0` 
4 -----> 3 ------>6(combined)
-------> 3 ------->
